Energy storage systems.Description: Batteries are widely used in energy storage systems to store electrical energy for later use.
Flywheels are used in energy storage systems to store rotational energy that can be converted back to electrical energy when needed.
Hydrogen fuel cells are used in energy storage systems to convert hydrogen gas into electrical energy, which can be stored for later use.
Supercapacitors are used in energy storage systems to store electrical energy at high power densities, allowing for rapid energy discharge when needed.
